result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony P Tipton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and surcharges, costs.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $1,461.67 to be paid to Walmart as a Condition of Probation.

Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.

No use or possession of alcohol or drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

No contact with Walmart in Muskego.  Maintain full-time employment. Court will allow for early termination of Probation after 1 year if all conditions have been met.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court grants expunction after 2 years upon written request of the defendant and upon successful completion of Probation, payment of all costs/fees, maintain full-time employment, remain current on child support and no new criminal law violations.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony P Tipton in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1, 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- 3 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 2 years Probation.  Court would allow for early termination of Probation after 1 year if all conditions have been met.
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Restitution of $1,461.67 to be paid to Walmart as a Condition of Probation.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  No contact with Walmart in Muskego.  Maintain full-time employment.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.   
CONDITION TIME: 60 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent.

Count 2:
- 3 months Huber with standard release conditions CONSECUTIVE to Count 1. STAYED
- 2 years Probation.  Court would allow for early termination of Probation after 1 year if all conditions have been met.
- Court costs waived.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.

Count 3:
- 3 months Huber with standard release conditions CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1 and 2. STAYED
- 2 years Probation.  Court would allow for early termination of Probation after 1 year if all conditions have been met.
- Court costs waived.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.

- Court grants expunction after 2 years upon written request of the defendant and upon successful completion of Probation, payment of all costs/fees, maintain full-time employment, remain current on child support and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant Anthony P Tipton in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any Wal Mart stores.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Anthony P Tipton in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
